title: $1B Crypto Liquidated After Iran Strikes
summary: US airstrikes on Iranian uranium sites triggered over $1B in crypto liquidations within 24 hours, wiping out 172,000 traders. Ethereum led losses with $296M liquidated while Bitcoin saw $152M, as the total crypto market cap dropped 4.4% to $3.25T amid heightened geopolitical tensions.

title: Kraken's Native BTC Yield via Babylon
summary: Kraken launched Bitcoin 'staking' using Babylon's time-lock protocol, offering up to 1% APR without wrapping or bridging. The service pays rewards in BABY tokens with a seven-day unbonding period, making Kraken the first major exchange to offer non-custodial BTC yield.

title: ETH ETFs See Largest Outflow in a Month
summary: Spot Ethereum ETFs recorded over $11M in outflows on Friday, the highest since mid-May, led by a $19.7M exit from BlackRock's ETHA fund as ETH dropped below $2,400. Despite the dip, ETH ETFs maintain $840M in net inflows this month while Bitcoin ETFs continue their 9-day inflow streak.

title: Nakamoto, KindlyMD Boost BTC Treasury to $763M
summary: Nakamoto and KindlyMD raised an additional $51.5M in PIPE funding, increasing their planned Bitcoin treasury to $763M pending merger approval. The firms aim to convert all funds into BTC with 7,316 BTC already escrowed, joining 228 companies now holding corporate Bitcoin treasuries.

title: Self Chain CEO Ousted Over $50M OTC Fraud Allegations
summary: Self Chain removed its CEO following allegations of involvement in a $50M crypto OTC fraud scheme. This represents a significant governance crisis and potential security breach affecting investor confidence in the protocol.

title: Texas Signs Strategic Bitcoin Reserve Bill Into Law
summary: Texas Governor Greg Abbott signed a strategic Bitcoin reserve bill into law, joining two other states in establishing official BTC reserves. This represents significant regulatory progress for Bitcoin adoption at the state government level in the United States.

title: Coinbase Secures EU-Wide Crypto Services Approval Under MiCA
summary: Coinbase obtained EU-wide crypto services approval under the Markets in Crypto-Assets (MiCA) regulation. This authorization allows Coinbase to operate across all EU member states with a single license, marking a major regulatory milestone for the exchange.

title: Trezor and Cointelegraph Face Phishing Attacks
summary: Trezor issued a phishing alert after attackers abused support contacts, while Cointelegraph's website was compromised with front-end exploits promoting fraudulent airdrops. These incidents highlight ongoing security threats targeting crypto users through trusted platforms.
